hero.title: Nepal Driving Licence Online System
hero.subtitle: Register, prepare, and apply for your driving licence easily and securely through the official Government of Nepal portal.

rules.title: Driving License Rules & Regulations
rules.subtitle: Essential information for new applicants in Nepal

documents.title: Required Documents
documents.citizenship: Original Nepali Citizenship card and a photocopy
documents.blood_group: Blood group certificate (optional if already known)

exam_process.title: Examination Process
exam_process.written: Written Exam: 20 questions (5 marks each). Need 80/100 to pass.
exam_process.trial: Practical (Trial): Score at least 70/100 following the new point system.

about.title: About the Portal
about.description: The Nepal Driving Licence Online System is a unified digital platform for licence registration, written exams, trial scheduling, and renewal management.
about.apply_desc: Submit your driving licence application, upload documents, and select your preferred DoTM office from anywhere in Nepal.
about.scheduling_desc: View available written and trial exam dates, choose a convenient slot, and receive SMS/email confirmation.
about.updates_desc: Track your application status, exam results, and licence issuance progress in real time.

safety.title: Safety & Traffic Rules
safety.subtitle: Essential guidelines for every driver in Nepal
safety.signals_desc: Obey traffic lights, stop lines, and traffic police hand signals.
safety.helmet_desc: Always wear a BIS-standard helmet and fasten your seatbelt.
safety.speed_desc: Follow posted speed limits and slow down near schools and hospitals.
safety.lane_desc: Keep to your lane, use indicators, and avoid sudden lane changes.
safety.zebra_desc: Stop for pedestrians at crossings and give priority to school children.
safety.alcohol_desc: Never drive under the influence of alcohol or narcotic substances.

exam.title: Driving Exam Information
exam.subtitle: Understand the written and practical trial exams before you apply.
written_list: Multiple-choice questions on traffic signs and rules.
Basic vehicle mechanics and road safety scenarios.
Available in Nepali; sample sets will be provided online.

process.title: Step-by-step process
process.subtitle: Follow these steps to obtain your driving licence through the portal.
process.step1_desc: Register with your email address and choose your role.
process.step2_desc: Provide personal details, address, and licence category.
process.step3_desc: Select available written and trial exam dates for your location.
process.step4_desc: Complete secure online payment using approved channels.
process.step5_desc: Appear at the designated DoTM office with required documents.
process.step6_desc: Complete the driving trial; successful candidates receive licence issuance notification.

notices.title: Public Notices & Announcements
notices.subtitle: Official updates from the Department of Transport Management.
notices.notice1_desc: The portal will be temporarily unavailable from 10:00 PM to 2:00 AM for scheduled system upgrades and security improvements.
notices.notice2_title: New trial routes for Kathmandu Valley
notices.notice2_desc: Updated trial exam routes and safety guidelines have been issued for licence categories A, B, and C.
notices.notice3_desc: Citizens are encouraged to participate in awareness programmes led by Nepal Traffic Police across all provinces.

apply_section.title: Apply Online
apply_section.subtitle: Create your secure account or log in to continue your licence application, manage exam dates, and view results.
apply_section.info_desc: Your personal information is encrypted and processed through secure government-approved systems. Only authorized officials can access your records.
info_list: Role-based dashboards for citizens and administrators.
Integrated exam and licence record management.

contact.title: Contact & Support
contact.subtitle: For technical assistance or queries regarding driving licence applications, please reach out to your nearest DoTM office.
